headline: Does AT&T's $29.5 Billion Credit Expansion Reshape the Bull Case for T?
summary: On November 3, 2025, AT&T secured amended credit facilities totaling US$29.5 billion, including a US$12.0 billion revolving credit agreement and a US$17.5 billion delayed draw term loan, to enhance its financial flexibility for general corporate purposes and potential spectrum acquisitions. This move significantly bolsters AT&T's liquidity position, addressing potential market concerns about its capital structure and capacity to manage future investments or operational needs. We'll assess...
